text: thanks. I had a look at goldman sachs and kpmg - thye both look good :slightly_smiling_face:
Yeahh, but I need to write a cover letter for both.. which is not really working out well :sweat::sweat:

I think I would start writing my letter for kpmg because they are giving you more hints about what they are looking for.

*kpmg*
It's a good idea to go through their list of "Key Skills*"* and try to show them in your letter and CV that you have them. also mention how exciting you think their "Training and Development" plan is.

*goldman sachs*
they already say what they want to see in the letter: "Cover letters should describe applicantsâ€™ motivation for wanting to pursue a Degree Apprenticeship vs. the traditional university route"
other than that, you can take the parts from the kpmg letter where you say how excited you are about the program (adapt a bit maybe).
I haven't watched the goldman sachs videos at the bottom but they might give you really good points to talk about too.

something where you can say "I was impressed how the students in 2016 were able to do XYZ" or a note about the perspectives they are outlining in the other video - "The perspectives I have as an apprentice with you motivate me to give my very best".
writing a first draft is always the hardest :slightly_smiling_face: don't let it discourage you - it doesn't need to be perfect
let me know when you have a few sentences our paragraphs and I'll have a read

Omg thanks a lot!! That's incredibly helpful! Thank youu!! 
I'll send u my first draft after I'm done with it
